slides.title: Types of Numbers
slides.content:
**Natural Numbers:** 1, 2, 3, 4... (counting numbers)
**Whole Numbers:** 0, 1, 2, 3... (natural + zero)
**Integers:** ...-2, -1, 0, 1, 2... (positive & negative)
**Even:** Divisible by 2 (2, 4, 6...)
**Odd:** Not divisible by 2 (1, 3, 5...)
**Prime:** Only 2 divisors (2, 3, 5, 7, 11...)

slides.title: LCM & HCF
slides.content:
**HCF (Highest Common Factor):** Largest number dividing both
*Example:* HCF of 12, 18 = 6

**LCM (Lowest Common Multiple):** Smallest number divisible by both
*Example:* LCM of 4, 6 = 12

**Formula:** HCF Ã— LCM = Product of numbers

slides.title: Divisibility Rules
slides.content:
**By 2:** Last digit even (0,2,4,6,8)
**By 3:** Sum of digits divisible by 3
**By 5:** Last digit 0 or 5
**By 9:** Sum of digits divisible by 9
**By 10:** Last digit 0
**By 11:** Difference of alternate digit sums divisible by 11

question.questionText: What is the HCF of 24 and 36?
